agent.speaker: agent
agent.text: The Lite plan is a free service plan with usage quotas. You can use the Lite plan to develop an app without any charges. The plan may be renewed monthly or used as a one-time offer. Lite pricing plans are accessible for all account types, and you can have one instance of a Lite plan for each service.

contexts.text:
* What's a Lite pricing plan for services?

A Lite plan is a free quota-based service plan. You can use a service's Lite plan to build an app without incurring any charges. A Lite plan might be offered on a monthly cycle that is renewed each month or on a one-off usage basis. Lite pricing plans are available with all account types. You can have one instance of a Lite plan for each service. For more information about Lite accounts, see [Account types](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/account?topic=account-accountsliteaccount).
* How many apps can I build?

There's no limit to the number of apps you can build in a Pay-As-You-Go or Subscription account.

If you created a Lite account before 12 August 2021, you can build and deploy apps with 256 MB of instantaneous runtime memory. To get 512 MB of free instantaneous runtime memory, upgrade to a Pay-As-You-Go or Subscription account and pay only for what you use over that limit.
* What happens when my Lite plan instance reaches the monthly quota?

Reaching any quota limit for Lite plan instances suspends the service for that month. Quota limits are per org, not instance. New instances that you create in the same org reflect any usage from previous instances. The quota limits reset on the first of every month.

You can check your usage by going to Manage > Billing and usage in the IBM Cloud console, and selecting Usage. For more information, see [Viewing your usage](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/billing-usage?topic=billing-usage-viewingusage).
* How many resource groups, orgs, or spaces can I create?

If you have a Pay-As-You-Go or Subscription account, there's no limit to the number of resource groups, orgs, or spaces that you can create. However, if you have a Lite account, you're limited to one org and one resource group.
* Can I change which notifications I receive?

|user|: Are the Lite pricing plans available with all account types in IBM Cloud
|assistant|: Yes, Lite pricing plans are available with all account types in IBM Cloud. You can have one instance of a Lite plan for each service. For more information about Lite accounts, you can refer to the Account types documentation.

agent.original_text:
A Lite plan is a free quota-based service plan offered by IBM Cloud. It allows you to build an app without incurring any charges. Lite plans can be offered on a monthly cycle that is renewed each month or on a one-off usage basis. They are available with all account types, and you can have one instance of a Lite plan for each service. For more information about Lite accounts, you can refer to the Account types documentation.
If you have a Lite account created before 12th August 2021, you can build and deploy apps with 256 MB of instantaneous runtime memory. To get 512 MB of free instantaneous runtime memory, you can upgrade to a Pay-As-You-Go or Subscription account and pay only for what you use over that limit.
Please note that reaching any quota limit for Lite plan instances will suspend the service for that month. Quota limits are per organization (org), not per instance. New instances that you create in the same org will reflect any usage from previous instances. The quota limits reset on the first of every month. You can check your usage by going to Manage > Billing and usage in the IBM Cloud console, and selecting Usage. For more information, see [Viewing your usage](https://cloud.ibm.com/docs/billing-usage?topic=billing-usage-viewingusage).
If you have a Pay-As-You-Go or Subscription account, there's no limit to the number of resource groups, organizations (orgs), or spaces that you can create. However, if you have a Lite account, you're limited to one org and one resource group.
You can also change which notifications you receive by updating your email preferences on the Email preferences page in the console. Click the Avatar icon to access this page.
